title: Do Rzeczy
text:
Do Rzeczy (, <a href="Literal%20translation">lit.</a> "To the point") is a <a href="Polish%20language">Polish-language</a> conservative and liberal weekly news and political magazine published in <a href="Warsaw">Warsaw</a>, <a href="Poland">Poland</a>. Weekly often promotes the <a href="Law%20and%20Justice">PIS party</a> narrative.
History and profile.
"Do Rzeczy" was established in January 2013 by Paweł Lisicki and a group of journalists who previously worked for the weekly magazine "<a href="Uwa%C5%BCam%20Rze">Uważam Rze</a>". The magazine is published on a weekly basis and has its headquarters in Warsaw. It has a <a href="Christianity">Christian</a> and <a href="conservative">conservative</a>-<a href="Liberalism">liberal</a> stance.
Paweł Lisicki is also <a href="editor-in-chief">editor-in-chief</a> of "Do Rzeczy", which provides articles on political news.
